description: Application for Minor Material Amendment (S73) to vary condition 2 (Approved Plans) pursuant to planning permission ref: 160969FUL dated 22/07/2016 for the redevelopment of the site with a four storey residential building containing 1 x 1 bed and 3 x 2 bedroom flats.  Minor material amendments involve: repositioning of building footprint, reduction in scale of three-storey element on north-east side, the addition of single-storey element at rear, and revisions to window configuration and internal layouts
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from 22nd July 2016 which is the the date of the original permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s) 97112 P(4-)01 Rev A, 97112 P(4-)02 Rev A, 97112 P(--)01, 97112 P(1-)01 Rev A, 97112 P(1-)02 Rev A received 17/10/2017
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.
| All external brickwork to be used in the development shall match the appearance of that of the neighbouring property no.4 Cherington Road.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Policies 7.4 and 7B of the Development Management, Development Plan Document; adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (April 2012); Policies 7.4, 7.5, and 7.6 of the London Plan (2015); and National Planning Policy Framework (March 2012). | Refuse storage shall be provided prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained permanently.

Reason: In the interests of the adequate disposal, storage and collection of waste and recycling, to protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety all in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) and 6.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 5.16 of the London Plan (2015) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | A minimum of (8 nos. total) cycle parking spaces in accordance with policy shall be provided and brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained permanently thereafter.
Reason: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policy 6.9 of the London Plan 2015.
